page.title: 19NW.SHERBORNE:A CONTROVERSY
page.content: A subject that has aroused much{local {discussion}is the L.E.A.'s recommendation to close Sherborne's two, single sex{grammar schools.}The reason given for this recommendation is that{falling numbers}on roll make it impossible to staff these schools adequately: the numbers of secondary age children in the area are likely to continue to fall for some while. A{working party}had been set up to look into possible alternatives, it held{public meetings}in the town and the surrounding villages to hear the views of the inhabitants. The working party's{report}to the County Council was later published. Heated debate continued in the{local paper,}the two schools (Lord Digby's School and Fosters School) being highly thought of. The matter is now before the Secretary of State for Education.
